result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee Schroeder

defendant.name: Schroeder, Christopher Lee
defendant.address: 2114 Harrison Avenue, Town of Beloit, WI 53511

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 22, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Activity: Bail/bond hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:19 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Schroeder appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Christopher Lee Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Kim Rau appeared by video for victim witness office. Victim A.O. appeared by phone. Court modifies bond conditions to add additional conditions of: Defendant to maintain 300 feet radius from victim, victims residence and place of employment. Not to post about victim at all on social media, all other conditions remain in effect. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by October 14, 2022. Remand to branch 4 for scheduling.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with A.O. Defendant to maintain 300 feet radius from victim, victims residence and place of employment. Not to post about victim at all on social media.

Activity: Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:51 AM Defendant Christopher Lee Schroeder appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by attorney Taylor Klokow by video for Christopher Lee Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Jessica Baker appeared by audio for victim witness office. Victim A.O. appeared by audio. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Jessica Baker recites modification of bond victim is requesting. Court does not modify bond at this time and matter continued for bail bond hearing. Bond to continue.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:43 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Schroeder appeared by phone.  Attorney Jason D Sanders appeared by video for Christopher Lee Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with A.O.

3:39 PM Defendant Christopher Lee Schroeder appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Christopher Lee Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $650 with conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with A.O.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
